metadata.title: CVE-2021-24001 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A compromised content process could have performed session historymanipulations it should not have been able to due to testing infrastructurethat was not restricted to testing-only configurations. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox < 88.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-24001` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 88.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
firefox-geckodriver - 88.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
firefox-mozsymbols - 88.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '88.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2').
mozjs78: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
